0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

Graphical representation of the results of a voltammetric measurement.

The measure of an electrical circuit element's inability to carry electrical current.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The quotient of faradaic current to total current passed.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A collection of concepts referring to photocatalysis.
Concentration of chemicals used for synthesis.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Describes a transformation that changes the chemical composition of involved materials.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The value of current (usually in A or mA) used to operate the selected light source.

The range of pore sizes in a material.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The diamensions of the - deposited on the substrate - thin film.

Quantitative and qualitative evaluation of the outcome of a catalytic reaction. The evaluation can lead to changes in the synthesis of the catalyst and / or selecting different experimental parameters.

An electrode in a three-electrode cell that is used only to make an electrical connection to the electrolyte so that a current can be applied to the working electrode.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The pH value in each of the synthesis steps.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The pressure (range) under which the catalytic reaction takes place.

Substances used as catalysts, supports, or reactants in catalytic processes.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Is a quantity describing how fast a product is formed in a chemical reaction. It is defined by the amount of product formed per unit of time.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A vocabulary for all areas of catalysis initiated in NFDI4Cat. Starting with photocatalysis we add more and more terms from other areas of catalysis and related disciplines like chemical engineering or materials science.

The depth of the substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The energy band of electronic levels of partially or fully filled mobile electrons in a metal or a semiconductor.

The light-driven reduction (conversion) of carbon dioxide (CO2) to hydrocarbons and / or platform chemicals in presence of water. The absorption of light and the adsorption of the reactants is performed by a photocatalyst (usually a metal oxide).
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A thin structural material (usually a sheet) used to separate the electrolyte of a divided electrochemical cell into two or more compartments.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Electromagnetic radiation with a wavelength typically in the range of 100-400 nanometers.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Entity with a concrete and physical nature.
The minimum concentration of a product or intermediate that the gas chromatograph can identify.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Τhe temporary state of a system with higher energy than its ground state caused by an external factor.

A series of temporal entities, like actions, events, changes, or functions that are not isolated but rather a connected sequence of activities. Processes often involve the transformation of inputs into outputs and can be conceptualized as workflows.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The frequency of an alternating (ac) current is a measure of how many times the direction of the current flow changes, in the same direction, per second. As the direction of flow changes back and forth, the total number of directional changes, per second, is twice the frequency.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Rate of increasing or decreasing the temperature during the calcination step. Usually mentioned in K min-1.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A technique which analyses the diffraction pattern produced when X-rays are scattered by a sample bombarded by a focused electron beam.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A stirred tank reactor model characterized by the absence of either feed or effluent flows. Examples modes of operation are batch (neither feed nor effluent), feed batch (only feed) , or drained batch (only effluent).

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a product B that is formed from a reactant A taking into account the stoichiometry. If A fully reacts to B without side-reactions, the yield of product B is 1 (or 100 %).
Absorption is the process in which energy (e.g., photons) or an absorbent (e.g., a gas) is taken up by an absorbate.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

A fast-rising potential pulse is enforced on the working electrode of an electrochemical cell and the electrical charge passing through this electrode is measured as a function of time.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The pressure at the end of the experiment or after a sampling event.

0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The process by which photogenerated charges (electrons and holes) in a semiconductor recombine, resulting in the dissipation of energy in the form of e.g., heat or light.
The portion of a powder catalyst sample that passes through a standard sieve of specified number and is retained by some finer sieve.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Specific of properties of the light source dictating its operation and its adequacy in the studied catalytic reaction.

0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electrochemical cell that converts electrical energy into chemical energy. The chemical reactions do not occur "spontaneously" at the electrodes when they are connected through an external circuit. The reaction must be forced by applying an external electrical current.
The power of the light source (usually in W or mW). The power can be calculated by the multiplication of the current and voltage used to operate the light source.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The final environment in which the electrochemical reaction happens. Includes possibly purged electrolyte.
The state caused by the transition of electrons from the valence band top to the conduction band bottom by absorption of photons of sufficient energy.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A physical quantity given by the volumetric flow entering a control volume devided by the size of the control volume; the quantity must be given in the unit 1/hour. In heterogeneous catalysis the volume of the undiluted catalyst bed is used as characteristic control volume. In case of gases the flow at reference conditions (0°C, 100 kPa = 1 bar) is used.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The width of the substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A tape-casting method used to deposit thin films of a catalyst onto the surface of a substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Equipment used in an electrochemical setup.

An electrochemical cell that converts chemical energy into electrical energy. A cell in which chemical reactions occur spontaneously at the electrodes when they are connected through an external circuit, producing an electrical current.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A mass flow controller (MFC) is a device used to measure and control the flow of liquids and gases. A mass flow controller is designed and calibrated to control a specific type of liquid or gas at a particular range of flow rates.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A surface made of a ceramic material (e.g., alumina) serving as a substrate for the deposition of a catalyst.
An apparatus or system designed for the controlled execution of reactions, encompassing a wide range of processes including chemical, nuclear, biochemical, or other physical transformations.

0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The H-Cell is a two-compartment electrochemical cell used for membrane testing, hydrogen permeation, or any other experiment where two separate electrode chambers are required.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Maximum and minimum of operation pressure range within the reactor can operate safely. Higher operation temperatures can lead to higher pressure values.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Final temperature of the calcination step.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electrochemical measuring technique used for electrochemical analysis or for the determination of the kinetics and mechanism of electrode reactions. A fast-rising current pulse is enforced on the working electrode of an electrochemical cell and the potential of this electrode is measured against a reference electrode as a function of time.
The thickness of the substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A dimensionless physical quantity describing the fraction of a reactant that reacts in a chemical conversion. If a reactant is consumed completely its conversion is 1 (or 100 %).
An analytical technique used to measure the energy loss of electrons passing through a sample.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A technique used to deposit uniform thin films onto a substrate by spraying a solution of the material onto the surface.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The energy level in a semiconductor where the probability of finding an electron is 0.5.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A resistant to thermal shock type of glass, composed mainly of silica and boron trioxide.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The band of energy levels in a solid fully occupied by electrons at 0 K (273.15 °C).

0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The transfer of a hole initiated by the absorption of a photon of sufficient energy.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An occurrence or happening, marked by a specific point in time. Events can be observed, recorded, and may have an impact on the state of the system or entities involved.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Thorough search of available literature on the research topic of interest using online research platforms (e.g, Scopus, Google Scholar, Web of Science, Research Gate etc.) and / or libraries. Relevant literature can be found in the form of publications, books, abstracts and conference presentations.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Defined as the amount of work needed per unit of electric charge to move the charge from a reference point to a specific point in an electric field. By definition, the electric potential at the reference point is zero units. A typical reference point is earth (ground).
A chemical compound (salt, acid, or base) that dissociates into electrically charged ions when dissolved in a solvent.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Pre-treatment of a catalyst before its introduction to the reaction chamber.
The two electronically conducting parts of an electrochemical cell.

0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The electrical potential difference at which the potential in a linear sweep or cyclic voltammetry is altered.
The process of separating positive and negative charges in a semiconductor, typically as a result of an external force, (e.g., photoexcitation).

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The movement of electrical charges in a conductor; carried by electrons in an electronic conductor (electronic current) or by ions in an ionic conductor (ionic current).

0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The bulk volume taken up by the catalyst and potential diluent in a fixed bed reactor.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A spectroscopy technique studying the vibrational modes of molecules, by measuring the intensity and frequency of scattered by the sample of monochromatic light.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Operation mode under the which the experiment takes place: batch of continuous flow mode.
Initial temperature of the calcination step.

0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The adhesion of a gas, liquid or dissolved solid chemical of interest onto a solid surface.
Mass of catalyst deposited onto the surface of a substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A measure to quantify how fast and selective a chemical conversion occurs over in presence of a catalyst. A chemical conversion may include multiple reactions.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Detectors of the mass spectrometer used to identify the reaction products and intemediates.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A catalyst introduced to the reaction chamber in the form of a thin film. To form a thin film, a (powdered) catalyst is deposited on a substrate (e.g., glass or metal) using an appropriate deposition technique.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource, 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann generalized the definition

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A reactor model, in which opposing to the ideal plug flow behavior, friction is acting on the fluid, thus creating a residence time distribution.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0001-5886-7860 Hendrik Borgelt created this resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The collection of instruments and devices used in an electochemical reaction. Can include electrodes, flow cells, beaker, does not include the electrochemical environment.

0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A measure to quantify how fast and selective a chemical conversion occurs in a reactor. A chemical conversion may include multiple reactions.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The electrode in a three-electrode cell where "the action is".
The range of parameters, critical for the safe operation of a reactor.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A flat surface made of a metal (e.g., titanium, stainless steel) serving as a substrate for the deposition of a catalyst.

Chemical reactors are often classified by their abstract concept. The reactor model type characterizes the basic physicochemical behavior of a reactor and thus creates a level of comparability between reactors. Different reactor model types are often used in simulation to simplify complex equations and physical behaviors.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0001-5886-7860 Hendrik Borgelt created this resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A type of gas chromatography detector that measures the thermal conductivity of a gas sample and identifies its constituent molecules through changes in a filament’s temperature.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A stirred tank reactor model with always present feed and effluent streams.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0001-5886-7860 Hendrik Borgelt created this resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A catalyst where the active material is usually the minority phase and fixed on a high surface area, relatively inert solid.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The gain of electrons or a decrease in the oxidation state of a species.
Electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths typically in the range of 800 nm - 20000 nm.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A physical quantity that describes the amount of product produced per unit of time and unit of producing entity. The producing entity is for example the volume of a chemical reactor or in catalysis the mass or volume or moles of catalyst. Example unit: kg{product} / (hour * cubicmeter{catalyst})
A physical quantity describing how fast a chemical reaction proceeds. It is defined by the change of the extend of reaction per unit of time.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A quantity describing the progress of a chemical reaction. For any chemical entitiy taking part in the reaction it is defined by the amount of chemical entity formed devided by its stoichiometric number in the reaction.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource, 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann modified the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The study of physical adsorption of gas molecules on a solid surface for the calculation of the specific surface area of materials.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Τhe lowest energy state of a system.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Minimum of operation temperature range within the reactor can operate safely.
Time (usually in h) for which a desired temperature is held.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The process of treating an electrolyte solution with gas.

0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A group of chemical reactions with common conditions or reactants, e.g. Oxidation, Hydrogenation, Reduction, Cracking.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A reaction vessel characterized by continuously fed reactnts, thorough mixing of fed reactants with the contents already present in the reactor by stirring and continous removal of a product stream from the system to maintain a constant volume.
A technique used to deposit uniform thin films onto a substrate (e.g., metal or glass) by spinning at high speeds a solution (paste) of the material onto the surface.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The number of datapoints per unit of time. Inverse of sampling interval.
The current that is flowing through an electrochemical cell and is causing (or is caused by) chemical reactions (charge transfer) occurring at the electrode surfaces.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The degree of a three-dimensional structural order of atoms which constitute the crystal lattice of a material.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A definition of best practice procedures to measure consistent datasets.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The measure of the amount of dissolved material (solute) in a solution.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Maximum of operation temperature range within the reactor can operate safely.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The temperature at the initiaton of the experiment.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A liquid that dissolves another material.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The temperature at which a chemical reaction is happening.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Those sites for adsorption which are the effective sites for a particular heterogeneous catalytic reaction.
A chemical reactor in which the reaction is carried out in the presence of a catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:prefLabel: mass of chemical substance for synthesis
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Mass of chemicals used for synthesis.
In voltammetry: a complementary pair of forward and reverse potential sweeps.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The diamensions of the substrate.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Optical systems involved in light irradiation.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A transparent material optimized to allow the transmission of electromagnetic radiation with low reflectance and scattering.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A lamp containing a mixture of mercury (Hg) and xenon (Xe) gases. Under electric current, the gas mixture gets ionized through a discharge electric charge creating a plasma generating UV and visible light.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A flat surface made of glass serving as a substrate for the deposition of a catalyst.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A process in which gaseous substances of known purity and concentration are introduced to the mass spectrometer and the respective mass-to-charge ratios are identified. This process when concluded, allows for the calculation of concentrations of products and intermediates of the photoreaction.
A technique used to measure the absorption, transmission or reflectance of light by a sample in the ultraviolet and visible regions of the electromagnetic spectrum.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Heat treatment to reach the desired final catalyst. The parameters of the heat treatment can vary between each calcination step.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A process which catalyzes a chemical reaction through the absorption of sufficient light energy by a photocatalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Equipment (e.g., a vacuum pump) used for controlling and / or monitoring the pressure in various parts of a reactor.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Material used for the construction of the main body of the reaction chamber.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The substate onto which a (powdered) catalyst is deposited. Such substrates include glass surfaces (e.g., borosilicate glass or conductive glass like ITO and FTO), ceramic substrates (e.g., alumina) or metal substrates (e.g., Ti foils, stainless steel etc.).
The concentration (usually in ppm or mol) of the products formed during a reaction.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The form in which the catalyst is introduced to the reaction chamber. This can include e.g., powders, pellets or thin films deposited on a substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A chemical compound formed by the reaction of a metal with oxygen.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The surface area of the substrate.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A method used in cyclic voltammetry to determine the charge carrier concentration and the flat-band potential of an electrochemical system by measuring the capacitance as a function of applied voltage.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas and 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Temporal entities that have a duration and occur at specific points in time.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Concentration of the reactants used to perform an experiment.

Purity of reactants used in an experiment. Purity is a measure of the impurities contained in the reactants' supply. The highest purity reactants should be used to ensure the collection of reliable results.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The shape of the reaction chamber. In gas-phase reactions, reaction chambers have usually a cylindrical, cubical or rectangular shape.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Minimum of operation pressure range within the reactor can operate safely.
A measure to quantify how fast and selective a chemical conversion occurs. A chemical conversion may include multiple reactions.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Equipment used in each step of the synthesis of the catalysts. The equipment can include (but not limited to): crucibles, pH meters, condensers, volumetric cylinders, centrifuges, test tubes, flasks, beakers, mechanical shakers, pipettes, syringes, magnetic stirrers, heating plates, filters, funnels, and digital balances.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Spectroscopic or chromatographic methods used to identify the products of the reaction qualitatively and quantitatively. Such devices are usually attached to the reactor, or a sample is being transferred to an identification method via another medium (e.g., gastight syringes).
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A thermal analysis technique which compares the heat flow in a sample and a reference material under controlled applied temperature profiles.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Chemical substances used in the synthesis process of a desired catalyst.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A specialized hydrodynamic electrode used in the study of the kinetics and mechanism of electrode reactions and in electroanalysis for ensuring a known and controllable flow of solution over the electrode.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The thickness of the membrane.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction that is in a different phase than the reagents.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The part of the reactor where the catalyst is located, characterized by length, diameter, volume.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: In laboratory equipment, a beaker is generally a cylindrical container with a flat bottom.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The electrode where reduction occurs in an electrochemical cell. It is the negative electrode in an electrolytic cell, while it is the positive electrode in a galvanic cell.
The cell voltage under zero current conditions.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A basic property of matter that gives rise to all electric and magnetic forces and interactions.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electrochemical measuring technique used for electrochemical analysis or for the determination of the kinetics and mechanism of electrode reactions. A fast-rising potential pulse is enforced on the working electrode of an electrochemical cell and the current flowing through this electrode is measured as a function of time.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A molecule that donates electrons from photoexcited species in a redox reaction and is subsequently consumed or degraded.
Treatment of a solid substance or mixtures of solids at elevated temperatures.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Current referred to the unit area of the electrode. Current divided by the true electrode area.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Assembly of literature research to include only the most relevant sources of information for the application / experiment / catalysts of interest.

0000-0001-5886-7860 Hendrik Borgelt created this resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An abstract concept/ideal reactor model type in which a liquid flows uniformly through the tube, resulting in a straight wave/flow front. Each fluid element has the same residence time.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The light intensity (usually in mW cm-2) of the selected light source. The light intensity should be measured at the same distance as the one between the light source and the reaction chamber / sample.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The dissolved species (e.g., a salt) in a solution.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Some characteristics that define the catalyst, which can be related to composition, active phase, or role.
The distance of the light source from the reaction chamber and the catalyst.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A synthesis method involving the thermal treatment of a mixture of substances in aqueous solution or in form of a slurry in water characterised by heating the mixture in a sealed reaction vessel to a temperature greater than the boiling point at standard pressure .
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The generation of electron - hole pairs in a semiconductor as a result of light absorption of sufficient energy to overcome the bandgap energy. Electrons (negative charge) get excited to the conduction band, while holes (positive charge) remain in the valence band.
Electron donors or hole scavengers used to reduce the recombination tendency of electrons and holes. Sacrificial reagents are used in catalysis to study an oxidation or reduction reaction separately.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The number of cycles in a measurement, such as a cyclic voltammetry.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A non-destructive analytical technique which uses a high-energy X-ray source to expose a material and monitors the emitted characteristic fluorescent X-Rays.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The energy state occupied by an electron in a catalyst. This state can affect the electron's ability to participate in a catalytic reaction.
All the necessary equipment needed to perform a catalytic experiment involving irradiation. The system apart from the light source can include, filters, power units, lamp cooling devices etc..
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The depth of the film of the deposited catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Diameter of the optical window allowing the incoming light to enter the reaction chamber and interact with the catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The material that the substrate is made of. Common materials include: glass (conductive or not), ceramics and metal.
A thin film of the catalyst deposited on an appropriate for the application substrate.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A spectroscopic technique that uses a static magnetic field and radiofrequency radiation to measure the magnetic resonance of atomic nuclei protons or electrons.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electron microscopy technique that produces high-resolution images under high magnification of a sample's surface by assessing the secondary and back-scattered electrons produced by a focused electron beam.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The total duration in which a catalyst is under irradiation by the selected light source.
Broad families of semiconducting materials (e.g., metal oxides) that can be used as catalysts in various applications.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The thickness of the film of the deposited catalyst.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An abstract concept/ideal reactor model type, in which the volume of fluid in the reaction vessel is considered to be perfectly mixed which results in the same concentration of all components in the whole reaction volume.
Source used to irradiate a catalyst in a reaction chamber. These include sources with various intensities, power, and wavelength ranges, including Hg/Xe lamps, Xe lamps and LEDs.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Operation mode in which the reaction chamber is filled with the (reactant) gas(es) up to a certain pressure, and the reaction products accummulate over time.
A process during which a chemical reaction is accelerated by the presence of a catalyst in a different phase than the reactant. The reaction generally proceeds at the interface.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The total duration of an experiment.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The temperature (range) under which the catalytic reaction takes place.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electronic instrument that controls the electrical potential difference between the working and reference electrodes of a three-electrode cell at a preset value.
The dimension of the optical window (diameter / thickness) allowing the incoming light to enter the reaction chamber and interact with the catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A powerful tool for examining processes occurring at electrode surfaces. A small amplitude ac (sinusoidal) excitation signal (potential or current), covering a wide range of frequencies, is applied to the system under investigation and the response (current or voltage or another signal of interest) is measured. It is routinely used in electrode kinetics and mechanism investigations, and in the characterization of batteries, fuel cells, and corrosion phenomena.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A reactor used to perform and study electrochemical reactions.
A gas flow under which the calcination step takes place (e,g,, Ar or synthetic air).
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The composition of chemical species fed to the inlet of a chemical reactor.
A substance that is added to a chemical reaction.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The pressure at the initiaton of the experiment or before a sampling event.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A multi-step process iniatiated by the absorption of photons by a photocatalyst. This process involves various sub-processes that include the photogeneration and transfer of electron and hole pairs.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Components being integral parts of a catalytic reactor.

A commonly used reference electrode. A hydrogen electrode immersed directly into the electrolyte of the electrochemical cell and usually (unless otherwise stated) operated with one atmosphere pressure hydrogen gas. The equilibrium potential depends on the hydrogen ion concentration (strictly speaking, activity) of the cell electrolyte.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Thickness of the optical window allowing the incoming light to enter the reaction chamber and interact with the catalyst.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A measure which is proportional to the amount of a product with a specific retention time. After calibration it is used to calculate gas concentrations of products of an chemical experiment.

rdf:Description.skos:prefLabel: volume of chemical substance for synthesis

Addition and organization of relevant literature of interest using a citation management software (e.g., Mendeley, Zotero, EndNote etc.) allowing for easy access and categorization.

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electrochemical measuring technique used for electrochemical analysis, for the determination of the kinetics and mechanism of electrode reactions, and for corrosion studies. "Voltammetry" is a family of techniques with the common characteristics that the potential of the working electrode is controlled (typically with a potentiostat) and the current flowing through the electrode is measured.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A voltammetry where the voltage changes linearly over time from a initial potential to a final potential.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The value of voltage (usually in V or mV) used to operate the selected light source.
The energy difference between a semiconductor’s valence band top and conduction band bottom, which is required to excite an electron from the former to the latter.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas and 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Any entity that cannot be located in space-time. E.g., mathematical entities, formal semantics elements, regions within dimensional spaces, ideas, conceptual models.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A device that converts chemical energy into electrical energy or vice versa when a chemical reaction is occurring in the cell. Typically, it consists of two metal electrodes immersed into an aqueous solution (electrolyte) with electrode reactions occurring at the electrode-solution surfaces. See also galvanic cell and electrolytic cell.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Is a quantity describing how fast a reactant is consumed in a chemical reaction. It is defined by the amount of reactant consumed per unit of time.
Detectors of the gas chromatogragh used to identify the reaction products and intemediates.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A method to synthesize mixed oxide/non-oxide powders by combustion of liquid precursor droplets in a flame.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The electrode where oxidation occurs in an electrochemical cell. It is the positive electrode in an electrolytic cell, while it is the negative electrode in a galvanic cell.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A process in which gaseous substances of known purity and concentration are introduced to the gas chromatograph and the respective area and retention time of the resulting peaks are identified. This process when concluded, allows for the calculation of concentrations of products and intermediates of the photoreaction.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The electrical potential at which a linear sweep or cyclic voltammetry starts.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A starting substance that undergoes a chemical reaction to produce a desired product.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke provided the definition
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A classification of chemical reactors based on the distinct design, configuration, and operational characteristics. Examples are stirred tank reactors, loop reactors, trickle beds, multitubular reactors, fluidized beds, and others. Each type is tailored to accomodate a specific combinations of reaction kinetics, thermodynamics, mass transfer requirements, and process variables.
Initial frequency in for example an electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Equipment used for controlling and/or monitoring the temperature in various parts of a reactor. This can include hot plates, heating elements and cryostats.
The width of the film of the deposited catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Necessary steps needed to follow to reach the desired catalyst.
The electrical potential at which a linear sweep or cyclic voltammetry ends.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: An electrochemical technique used to study the redox properties of a sample by measuring the current produced by an applied voltage sweep.
The measurement of the open circuit voltage of an electrochemical cell.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The phenomenon of movement (transportation) of electrical charge (that is, the electrical current) from one part of the electrochemical cell to another, occurring mainly as electromigration of ions, but it can also occur by diffusion of ions. See electrochemical potential.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A type of catalytic test, where the depletion of formation of chemical substances is measured, usually performed under differential conditions
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Final frequency in for example an electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A construction inside of which the catalyst and the reactants coexist, and the reaction takes place.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths visible to the human eye, typically in the range of 400-800 nm.
A molecule that accepts electrons from photoexcited species in a redox reaction and is subsequently consumed or degraded.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A type of pure silicon dioxide, highly crystalline glass that allows the transmission of light in the UV wavelength range.
The rate of flow of reactants (often in ml per min) in the photoreactor. Flow rates are usually controlled by mass flow controllers (MFCs).
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Α mechanical device that removes gas molecules from a sealed chamber reaching pressures lower than the atmospheric pressure.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The sum of all faradaic efficiencies in an experiment. If all current is accounted for should be 1.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: A high-resolution imaging technique that measures the interaction between a sharp probe and the sample’s surface to create a three-dimensional image of the surface’s morphology.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Volume of the reaction chamber, calculated by its dimensions. Volume of pipes and valves connected to the reaction chamber should also be calculated and added to the total volume.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Characteristic properties of a semiconductor used in catalysis. These properties determine its performance in the studied catalytic application.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas and 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Anything that has a temporal dimension, whether it is an instantaneous point in time, a duration, or a sequence of events.
Techniques used to modify the properties of a catalyst, with the aim to increase its efficiency in a catalytic application.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The distance between two successive peaks or troughs in a wave.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A technique that analyzes the chemical composition of an X-ray irradiated sample by measuring the energies of the emitted electrons.
Α measure of the total surface area of a material per unit mass or volume.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The loss of electrons or an increase in the oxidation state of a species.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The transfer of an electron initiated by the absorption of a photon of sufficient energy.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource, 0000-0002-2367-1988 Norbert Kockmann edited the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The area of the substrate covered by the deposited catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Pressure applied (if necessary) in any of the synthesis step. Changes in the pressure may be observed if variations in the temperature of the reaction occur (e.g., exothermic reaction).
A technique used to deposit (immobilize) a (powdered) catalyst on a substate. These techniques include (but are not limited to): doctor blading, spin coating, spray coating, etc..
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Detector incorporating Ionization via a new dielectric barrier discharge He plasma.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: Gas which is used in purging.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A solid-state semiconductor emitting light at highly controllable (narrow) wavelength ranges.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A measure of the time taken for a solute to pass through a chromatography column. It is the mean of the residence time distribution; it is known as the first moment of the residence time distribution.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A catalyst that consists mainly of the active ingredient or phase.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The flow of gas (usually in ml min-1) used in the calcination steps during synthesis.
The time in between the collection of two data points.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The introduction of foreign atoms into a semiconductor leading to the formation of new energy levels and charge concentrations.

A type of catalytic test, where the performance of the catalyst is measured over an extended time period. Not to be performed at full conversion to be able to see catalyst deactivation, but usually also not at differential conditions to see the effect of product concentration on the catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The temperature at the end of the experiment.
Time for which a gas is purged through the reaction chamber.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A lab-scale experiment performed to test the efficiency of a studied photocatalyst in a photocatalytic application.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Under flow conditions, a continuous flow of reactants is supplied to the reaction chamber and the formed products are removed and identified by an appropriate technique.
A material with electrical conductivity between that of a conductor and an insulator.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke generalized the definition
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A dimensionless physical quantity describing how effective a reactant is converted to the desired product in a chemical conversion. It is calculated as the ratio between the amount of the desired product and the amount of the desired product that could have been formed if all reactants were converted to the desired product. The selectivity is 1 (or 100 %) if no other than the desired product is formed.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: The pressure drop occurring when collecting a gaseous sample from the reaction chamber. This pressure drop should be taken into consideration when calculating the concentration of formed products.
A device that measures a specific physical or chemical property and converts it into readable signal, often for continuous monitoring.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Details describing the construction, physical dimensions, and operation of the photoreactor used to perform a photocatalytic reaction.
A synthesis method in which inorganic compounds are dissolved in a solvent and brought into contact with a solid support in order to deposit them completely or in parts onto the surface.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: An extension of the concept of the tubular reactor model, in that the fluid does not flow though a straight tube but through a tube with regular bends, e.g. a coiled tube, which modifies the residence time distribution as compared to a straight tube.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0001-5886-7860 Hendrik Borgelt created this resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource, 0000-0002-5898-1820 David Linke contributed to the definition of the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A reaction rate that is normalized either to mass of active ingredient, surface area or certain measured adsorption sites.
Charge referred to the unit area of the electrode. Charge divided by electrode area.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: In contrast to substrate area, the actual area of a sample or electrode which is active.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource

rdf:Description.skos:definition: The mass per area on a thin film sample, i.e. the working electrode.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0009-0008-1278-8890 Michael Götte created the resource
0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: Temperature externally applied (if necessary) in any of the synthesis step. Higher temperature values can be observed if an exothermic reaction takes place during the synthesis.

rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-4041-0165 Julia Schumann created the resource
rdf:Description.skos:definition: A process, during which elevated temperature is applied to increase the reaction rate of a reaction in presence of a catalyst.
Duration of each synthesis step needed to synthesize the desired catalyst.
rdf:Description.skos:historyNote: 0000-0002-6242-2167 Nikolaos G. Moustakas created the resource
